name: Kava In Tanoa Bowl
description: A wooden Kava or 'Yaqoona' bowl is culturally significant in Fiji as its used to hold the root crop drink its in liquid form. These are viewed in Fijian and Polynesian society as a central part of public ritual and the deepest of bowls are used for serving the drink across a gamut of ceremonies from welcoming honoured guests, weddings, house warmings and culturally significant events. A cord at the front would be used for hanging up a bowel used (made by coconut) when its not in use.
